intro.description:
This cheat sheet will demonstrate how to configure PDE and use it to create, modify and test a plug-in.
To learn more about using cheat sheets, click the help button in the top right corner (?).

item.title: Configure PDE
item.description: To configure PDE, perform the following steps

subitem.label: Select "Window->Open Perspective->Other..." from the main menu and choose "Plug-in Development" in order to open the plug-in development perspective
Select "Window->Preferences" from the main menu, expand the "Plug-in Development" outline tree node within the resulting dialog, and choose "Target Platform".
Verify that the "Target Definitions:" check box list has one Target Platform selected as active.
Select the Active Target Platform, Click Edit and verify that all checkboxes corresponding to plug-in entries listed in the list box on the "Content" tab are checked.
Click "OK".

item.title: Create the plug-in
item.description: To create the plug-in perform the following steps

subitem.label: Select "File->New->Project..." from the main menu, expand the "Plug-in Development" category within the resulting "New Project" dialog box, and choose "Plug-in Project"
Input "com.example.helloworld" into the "Project Name" text box
Accept the rest of the default preloaded values on the "Plug-in Project" page and click "Next >"
Accept the default preloaded values on the "Content" page. Verify that "Rich Client Applications" section marks No. Click "Next >"
Select the "Hello, World" template from the list of "Available Templates" and click "Finish"

item.title: Modify the plug-in
item.description:
After the new plug-in project wizard is finished from the previous step, the plug-in editor is launched for your new project with the Overview page showing.
To modify your com.example.helloworld plug-in, perform the following steps:

subitem.label: Select the "Extensions" tab
Expand the "org.eclipse.ui.actionSets" tree dialog under the "All Extensions" heading
Expand the "Sample Action Set" tree dialog
Select the "Sample Menu" entry
Replace the content of the "label" text box under the "Extension Element Details" heading with "Hello Menu"
Select the "Sample Action" entry under the "All Extensions" heading
Replace the content of the "label" text box under the "Extension Element Details" heading with "Display Hello World"
Select "File->Save" from the main menu

item.title: Test the plug-in
item.description: To test your Eclipse plug-in inside a target Eclipse platform, perform the following steps:

subitem.label: Select the "Overview" tab
Click the "Launch an Eclipse application" hyperlink under the "Testing" heading.
Note the "Hello Menu" entry in the main menu in the newly launched Eclipse platform.
Select "Hello Menu->Display Hello World" from the main menu.
Verify that a dialog box is displayed with the title "Helloworld" and message as "Hello, Eclipse world". Click "OK" to close it.
Click on the "Workbench" icon to close the "Welcome" view and go to the Eclipse workbench.
Note the icon with the Eclipse logo in the main toolbar in the newly launched Eclipse platform.
Click the icon with the Eclipse logo in the main toolbar.
Verify that a dialog box is displayed with the title "Helloworld" and message as "Hello, Eclipse world". Click "OK" to close it.
Select "File->Exit" from the main menu to exit the target Eclipse platform
